pr_title: Add support for the JSON-B Serialization of Vert.x JSON Object/Array

timeline.message:
Add support for the JSON-B Serialization of Vert.x JSON Object and JSON Array

Fix #8830

timeline.bodyText: Why do you add that one here and in the other pom?
timeline.author: gsmet

replies.bodyText: There are some methods from Vert.x JSON Object (used in term) that requires Jackson (to rebuild a JSON Object from a String for instance).  It's only used in tests as I've been careful when implementing the serializers/deserializers to NOT use these methods.
replies.author: cescoffier

replies.bodyText: What bugs me a bit is that we can't really be sure that we don't need Jackson around for it to work.
replies.author: gsmet

replies.bodyText:
No, we don't , it's the same mechanism that is used for Vert.x. Some method requires Jackson, but we don't require Jackson. If the user uses these methods, then he will have to add the Jackson extension.
Not the tests in resteasy-mutiny that does NOT depend on Jackson and works.
We also have the same technic in quarkus-resteasy (providing the body reader/writer for JsonObject/JsonArray)
replies.author: cescoffier

replies.bodyText: Can we talk about it on Zulip on Monday? I'm not sure I fully understand what you're saying.
replies.author: gsmet

replies.bodyText: We're Tuesday, but works for me :-)
replies.author: cescoffier
